dt-api.name: off()

type.description: Remove event listeners that have previously been added with `-api on()`.
type.parameter: Event name to remove. Multiple events can be removed by using a space separator or namespaced events with a dot separator.
Specific callback function to remove if you want to unbind a single event listener. If not given, all events which match the event name / namespace given in the first parameter will be removed.

dt-api.description:
DataTables can trigger a number of events which can be useful for taking action when DataTables performs those events. For example, it is often useful to know when an Ajax event occurs (`-event xhr`), so you can add additional data to the JSON payload.
DataTables provides three methods for working with DataTables events:
* `-api on()` - Listen for events * `-api off()` - Stop listening for events * `-api one()` - Listen for a single event.
This `-api off()` method is used to remove a listener that has already been attached to a DataTable. Simply pass in the event you wish to remove the listener for, and optionally the specific function if you want to remove only a single event listener.
Backwards compatibility note: if jQuery is loaded on your page, or registered with DataTables (`-api DataTable.use()`), DataTables will use jQuery for event handling. As of DataTables 3, if jQuery is not available, it will use its own event handling.

example.title: Listen for only the first `-event xhr` event from DataTables
